channel.title: Peter Chuzie's blog
channel.description: Recent content on Peter Chuzie's blog

item.title: Bar Plots
item.description: First, bring in all the neccessary tools … library(Lahman) library(sqldf) library(ggplot2) THen, to create a bar plot we …. query<-"SELECT name,HR FROM Teams WHERE yearID=1980 ORDER BY HR" result<-sqldf(query) result$name<-factor(result$name,levels=result$name) ggplot()+ geom_bar(data=result,aes(x=name,y=HR),stat='identity',color="white",fill="blue")+ coord_flip()+ ylab("Homeruns")+ xlab("Teams")+ ggtitle("1980 Team Homerun Distribution")

item.title: Histograms
item.description: Bring in the required tools … library(Lahman) library(sqldf) library(ggplot2) Next, Select your data and make a histogram, which is a diagram consisting of rectangles whose area is proportional to the frequency of a variable and whose width is equal to the class interval … query<-"SELECT weight FROM Master" result<-sqldf(query) ggplot()+ geom_histogram(data=result,aes(x=weight),color="green",fill="white",bins=50)+ ggtitle("Body Weight Distribution for Baseball Players")

item.title: Time Series
item.description: Bring in the required tools … library(Lahman) library(sqldf) library(ggplot2) … next, we will make a time series which is a a series of values of a quantity obtained at successive times, often with equal intervals between them. … this will show the movement of data over time … #### Extraction of data---------------------------- query<-"SELECT yearID,HR FROM Batting WHERE playerID='ruthba01'" result<-sqldf(query) #### Visualization of data------------------------- ggplot()+ #geom_point(data=result,aes(x=yearID,y=HR))+ geom_line(data=result,aes(x=yearID,y=HR))+ ggtitle("Ruth's Homerun Totals Throughout the Years")+ xlab("Year")+ ylab("Homeruns")
